trans-unit.source: Represents a type-level attribute that reports which property of the type maps to the XAML [x:Name attribute](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/x-name-directive.md).
The property that is specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute> must be of type <xref:System.String> and must be read/write.
Frameworks might attribute a certain property of one its architectural base elements to be the XAML name equivalent.
This is done so that the concept of a XAML name in a XAML namescope set at XAML load time is available to a framework's programming model at run time.
A XAML name value must use the [XamlName Grammar](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/xamlname-grammar.md).
In previous versions of the .NET Framework, this class existed in the WPF-specific assembly WindowsBase.
In [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], <xref:System.Windows.Markup.RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute> is in the System.Xaml assembly.
For more information, see [Types Migrated from WPF to System.Xaml](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/types-migrated-from-wpf-to-system-xaml.md).

An example of an existing class in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] where the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute> is applied is <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement>.

The <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property on <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> is attributed with <xref:System.Windows.Markup.RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute>, which results in any <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> derived class also using <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> as its run-time name property.
In general, you do not typically need to apply this attribute in WPF unless you are implementing a new or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement>-parallel framework-level class.
`x:Name` should take precedence over the run-time name property if both exist as attributes on an element, and a XAML processor implementation generally throws in this case.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute"></xref> class.
The specified property must be of type <xref:System.String> and have get and set access.
The name of the property to use as the `x:Name` equivalent of the class.
Gets the name of the runtime name property that is specified by this <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute"></xref>.
